controller

Class MainWindowController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.MainWindowController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable

    public class MainWindowController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    The Controller class handles user-interaction within the main window of the application. It contains the methods and parameters linked to the graphical user interface elements that the user can interact with, and handles the changes that happen based on what the user does within the application.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.net.URL location,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
        A concrete implementation of the method in interface Initializable. Initializes the game, draws the first board and sets up the animation keyframe and timeline. Sets formatting for text-input fields and sets initial values of ColorPickers and ChoiceBoxes. Starts together with the application.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        location - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
        resources - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.
        See Also:
        timeline, fpsLabel, fileHandler, board, gOL, ruleInputField, textInputDialogStatistics, chooseRulesBox, cellColorPicker, backgroundColorPicker, draw(), addNewKeyFrame(), setFPS(), CanvasDrawer.setZoomOffset(Board, Canvas), FileHandler.setBoard(Board), FileHandler.setGol(GameOfLife), GameOfLife.setThreadWorkers(ThreadWorker)

      • chooseCellColor

        public void chooseCellColor()
        Method to change the current cell color. Is called when the user interacts with the cell color picker. Sets the color and calls the draw() method.
        See Also:
        currentCellColor, cellColorPicker, draw()

      • chooseBackgroundColor

        public void chooseBackgroundColor()
        Method to change the current background color. Is called when the user interacts with the background color picker. Sets the color and calls the draw() method.
        See Also:
        currentBackgroundColor, backgroundColorPicker, draw()

      • startClick

        public void startClick()
        Method called when the user clicks the start/pause button within the game. Depending on boolean isRunning, the game will start or pause the timeline. If isRunning is false, it will set the text on the button to pause, the boolean to true and finalize any loaded patterns, before starting the game. If it is already running, it will change the button to "start" and set relevant values before pausing the timeline.
        See Also:
        isRunning, startButton, isMovable, aliveLabel, timeline, Board.finalizeBoard(), Board.getCellsAlive()

      • backToCenterClick

        public void backToCenterClick()
        Method called when the user clicks the "center view" button within the game. Will call CanvasDrawer's resetOffset() method so that the view will be back on the center of the board, and call draw().
        See Also:
        board, canvasArea, draw(), CanvasDrawer.resetOffset(Board, Canvas)

      • resetClick

        public void resetClick()
        Method to reset the game. Is called when the user clicks on the "reset"-button. Stops the animation, sets the number of generations to 0 and makes all cells dead. Should the Board be an instance of DynamicBoard, it will reset the grid to the default value.
        See Also:
        timeline, startButton, isRunning, isMovable, generationLabel, aliveLabel, draw(), GameOfLife.resetGenCounter(), GameOfLife.getGenCounter(), Board.resetBoard(), Board.getCellsAlive(), DynamicBoard.setGridSize(int), CanvasDrawer.resetCellSize(), CanvasDrawer.resetOffset(Board, Canvas), FileHandler.resetMetaData()

      • closeClick

        public void closeClick()
        Method to exit the application. Is called when the user clicks on the "exit"-button.

      • gridClick

        public void gridClick()
        Method used to toggle the grid on of off. Is called when user clicks on the "grid"-button.
        See Also:
        gridToggle, draw()

      • mousePressed

        public void mousePressed(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
        Method that lets the user interact with the board by pressing the mouse button on it. If the left mouse button is clicked, it will call the method to draw cells on the board, while the right button will set an initial value for panning, if the user ends up dragging the mouse.
        Parameters:
        mouseEvent - The event where the user presses the left mouse button on the canvas.
        See Also:
        aliveLabel, canvasArea, board, draw(), CanvasDrawer.drawPressed(MouseEvent, Board, boolean), CanvasDrawer.setOriginalDrag(MouseEvent), Board.getCellsAlive()

      • mouseDragged

        public void mouseDragged(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
        Method that lets the user interact with the board by pressing the mouse button on it. If the left mouse button is clicked, it will call the method to draw cells on the board, while the right button will allow for panning around the canvas, allowing the user to isMovable around the board visually.
        Parameters:
        mouseEvent - The event where the user presses the left mouse button on the canvas.
        See Also:
        aliveLabel, canvasArea, board, draw(), CanvasDrawer.drawDragged(MouseEvent, Board, boolean), CanvasDrawer.setDragOffset(MouseEvent), Board.getCellsAlive()

      • mouseDragOver

        public void mouseDragOver()
        Method that is called when the user releases the mouse button, calling CanvasDrawer's setEraseFalse() method.
        See Also:
        canvasArea, CanvasDrawer.setEraseFalse()

      • rulesOnEnter

        public void rulesOnEnter()
        Method called when pressing enter within the rules input box. Allows for inputting custom rules, and will try setting them. Checks the predefined set of rules to take metadata from. Produces a warning if the formatting is wrong.
        See Also:
        ruleInputField, ruleLabel, chooseRulesBox, GameOfLife.setRuleString(String), PopUpAlerts.ruleAlert2()

      • chooseRulesClick

        public void chooseRulesClick()
        Method called when choosing an element in the rule choice box. Sets the current playing rules to what is chosen. Produces a warning if something goes wrong.
        See Also:
        chooseRulesBox, ruleLabel, GameOfLife.getRuleString(), GameOfLife.setRuleString(String), PopUpAlerts.ruleAlert2()

      • movePattern

        public void movePattern(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent keyEvent)
        Method called when the user presses a keyboard button related to moving or rotating a loaded pattern. Will check if boolean isMovable is true, and return otherwise. If true, it will call the related method from the Board class in order to isMovable or rotate the loaded pattern. Move will only be true if a pattern is loaded and the game is not running.
        Parameters:
        keyEvent - The key pressed by the user.
        See Also:
        isMovable, draw(), Board.getCellsAlive(), Board.movePattern(String), Board.rotate(boolean), Board.finalizeBoard(), Board.discardPattern()

      • scrollZoom

        public void scrollZoom(javafx.scene.input.ScrollEvent scrollEvent)
        Method related to zooming with the mouse wheel. Called when the user scrolls. Depending on what the current cell size is, it will divide the scrollEvent accordingly, so that the level of zoom remains relatively consistent. Calls CanvasDrawer's setZoom() and draw().
        Parameters:
        scrollEvent - The event in which the user scrolls with the mouse wheel.
        See Also:
        draw(), CanvasDrawer.getCellDrawSize(), CanvasDrawer.setZoomOffset(Board, Canvas)

      • importFileClick

        public void importFileClick()
        Method that allows for importing an RLE-file from disk. Lets the user choose a file-path to load and if valid will load that file through the FileHandler object. Will produce a warning if the file location is invalid.
        See Also:
        timeline, generationLabel, aliveLabel, ruleLabel, canvasArea, draw(), GameOfLife.resetGenCounter(), GameOfLife.getGenCounter(), FileHandler.readGameBoardFromDisk(File), PopUpAlerts.ioAlertFromDisk(), CanvasDrawer.resetOffset(Board, Canvas), Board.getCellsAlive()

      • importURLClick

        public void importURLClick()
        Method that allows for importing an RLE-file from an URL. Lets the user input an URL and if valid will load the URL through the FileHandler object. Will produce a warning if the URL is is invalid, or does not contain an RLE file.
        See Also:
        timeline, generationLabel, aliveLabel, ruleLabel, canvasArea, draw(), GameOfLife.resetGenCounter(), GameOfLife.getGenCounter(), FileHandler.readGameBoardFromURL(String), PopUpAlerts.ioAlertFromURL(), CanvasDrawer.resetOffset(Board, Canvas), Board.getCellsAlive()

      • showRuleDescription

        public void showRuleDescription()
        Method called when the user clicks the view rules description button. Calls the ruleDescription() method from PopUpAlerts to produce a popup window containing a description of the selected rules.
        See Also:
        GameOfLife.getRuleName(), GameOfLife.getRuleString(), GameOfLife.getRuleDescription(), PopUpAlerts.ruleDescription(String, String, String)

      • showMetadata

        public void showMetadata()
        Method called when the user clicks the view metadata button. Calls the metaData method from PopUpAlerts to produce a popup window containing a description of the selected rules.
        See Also:
        FileHandler.getMetaTitle(), FileHandler.getMetaData(), PopUpAlerts.metaData(String, String)

      • editorButtonClick

        public void editorButtonClick()
        Method called when the user presses the "export" button. Pauses the game and opens the export/editor window. Sets the GameOfLife and Board objects, and re-sizes the board if it is non-quadratically and instance of DynamicBoard. Should the operation fail, the user will get a message.
        See Also:
        timeline, editorStage, editorController, Board.finalizeBoard(), Board.discardPattern(), Board.getHeight(), Board.getWidth(), DynamicBoard.expandWidthRight(int), DynamicBoard.expandHeightDown(int), EditorController.setExportBoard(Board), EditorController.setGameOfLife(GameOfLife), EditorController.drawEditorBoard(), EditorController.drawStrip(), CanvasDrawer.resetOffset(Board, Canvas), PopUpAlerts.ioAlertFXML()

      • showStatistic

        public void showStatistic()
        Method called when the user presses the "Show Statistics" button. Pauses the game and opens a text input dialog for the user to choose how many iterations to show statistics for.
        See Also:
        timeline, startButton, isRunning, textInputDialogStatistics, progressStage, progressController, StatisticsController.makeChart(), ProgressController.setIterations(int), ProgressController.setGameOfLife(GameOfLife), PopUpAlerts.ioAlertFXML()

      • openPatternSelect

        public void openPatternSelect()
        Method called when the user presses the "Import from Preset" button. Pauses the game and opens the import from preset.
        See Also:
        timeline, startButton, isRunning, patternSelectStage, canvasArea, fileHandler, PatternSelectController.setFileHandler(FileHandler), CanvasDrawer.resetOffset(Board, Canvas), PopUpAlerts.ioAlertFXML()

      • showAbout

        public void showAbout()
        Method called when the user presses the "About / Help" button. Opens an informational window with information about the game and how to play it.
        See Also:
        fileHandler, AboutController
